headline.main: SURF HOTEL SOLD FOR $1,500.; State Got it in 1892 for $210,000 During the Cholera Scare.

docs.abstract: Surf Hotel on Fire Is, NY, sold by state for $1,500
docs.lead_paragraph: The old Surf Hotel on Fire Island, once upon a time the glory of Long Island, has been sold and the State, as a result, is about $1,500 richer. With the famous old inn went the barroom, all the bath houses, the Captain's mess, the nurses' hall, and all the furniture in them.

headline.main: POILLON SISTERS DODGE SENTENCE; Habeas Corpus Writ Reprieves Them While Awaiting Judgment in Special Sessions. BACK IN THE TOMBS AGAIN Story of Their Filttings from Hotel to Hotel Told In Court -- Always Left a Trunk.

docs.abstract: sisters get stay of sentencing until next wk; lawyer reptdly seeks papers to prove they intended to pay hotel bills
docs.lead_paragraph: The Poillon sisters, Katherine and Charlotte, yesterday avoided sentence in Special Sessions, a date for which had already been twice set. They are charged with beating board bills at many hotels.
docs.snippet: The Poillon sisters, Katherine and Charlotte, yesterday avoided sentence in Special Sessions, a date for which had already been twice set. They are charged with beating board bills at many hotels....

headline.main: GETTING USED TO NEW CARS.; Public Was Confused by Changes in Broadway and 42d St. Service.

docs.abstract: Poillon sisters obtain postponement of their sentence for non-payment of hotel bills in order to bring out new evidence against 15 or 16 others
docs.lead_paragraph: The public showed yesterday that it is coming to a better understanding of the changes that were inaugurated last Monday in the Forty-second Street crosstown and Broadway trolley car service. The chief cause of confusion has been that many persons fail to take notice that some of the southbound Broadway cars, which formerly went on down Broadway below Times Square, now turn east on Forty-second Street.

docs.abstract: Editorial on mediocre service at US hotels
docs.lead_paragraph: With the chef of a Crown Princess here to study American cooking, and the views of so able a caterer as LOUIS SHERRY on the comparative merits of American and European hotels freshly placed before the public, good eating and good living become timely subjects of comment. The most obvious comment is that both can be best obtained in one's own home.

headline.main: " ANY WOMAN'S A LADY WHO BEHAVES THAT WAY"; This Is the New Hotel Attitude Toward Those Unescorted. THE OLD RULE WITHDRAWN Waldorf and Other Hotels and Restaurants Have Opened Their Dining Rooms to the "New" Woman.

docs.abstract: Humorous article on NYC hotels serving unescorted women
docs.lead_paragraph: Just what is meant by the term "lady" would puzzle anybody who should make a tour of the city's hotels and restaurants where fine distinctions are drawn regarding the right of an unescorted woman to eat dinner.
docs.snippet: Just what is meant by the term "lady" would puzzle anybody who should make a tour of the city's hotels and restaurants where fine distinctions are drawn regarding the right of an unescorted woman to eat dinner....

headline.main: HOTEL WRECKED BY DYNAMITE.; Supposed Destroyer of the Golden Eagle at Washington Commits Suicide -- Revenge His Motive.

docs.abstract: Wash. Golden Eagle dynamited by McKie
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 25 -- The Golden Eagle Hotel, at New Jersey Avenue and D Street, was dynamited this morning at 4:30 o'clock by Frank McKie, one of the guests, who subsequently committed suicide. Between twenty and thirty guests were thrown from their beds by the explosion, but only the proprfetor, Louis Brandt, and his wife were injured, the latter seriously.

docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, April 29. -- The Kreuz Zeitung, commenting upon the war in the Philippines, says that it becomes more evident that the United States cannot solve the task which it has taken upon itself there with mere volunteer regiments.

headline.main: HOTEL BEATS MUST NOW BE CAREFUL; Managers Have a Confidential Agency to Keep Track of Undesirable Guests.

docs.lead_paragraph: To protect themselves against professional beats, the hotel managers of this city have organized a confidential agency to keep track of all persons who do not pay their hotel bills. The agency has offices in a down-town building, and officers and clerks, who have evolved a very simple system of warning subscribers against beats.
